metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3546 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Moodle through 2.3.11, 2.4.x before 2.4.11, 2.5.x before 2.5.7, 2.6.x before 2.6.4, and 2.7.x before 2.7.1 does not enforce certain capability requirements in (1) notes/index.php and (2) user/edit.php, which allows remote attackers to obtain potentially sensitive username and course information via a modified URL.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3546` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

moodle - 2.7.5+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: moodle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.5+dfsg-1').
